CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 12, 1960, pg. 5, reads: "Bad Housing Conditions - Mrs. Thelma Thompson, who lives on the side of a hill in an out-of-the-way house at 1710 Arcena St., is shown with three of her children, ages 2 to 13, who make their home in a house which has windows that cannot be closed completely, scores of mice and rat holes, a leaking roof, and poorly plastered walls which boast neither paint nor paper. She has had application for housing project home on file for 10 years. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Thelma Thompson and her three children, Christopher, Mark, and Barbarette, seated on a bed in their dilapidated home at 1710 Arcena Street, Hill District
